title: Ruqqus is now quarantining guilds. Certain words in your post and you can’t reach /all.

body: I though the code was open source?
body_html: I though the code was open source?

guild.description:
The official guild for all things Ruqqus.

Rules:

💻 No promotion of other sites that aren't a fork of Ruqqus

🟪 Ruqqus-related only. This is a community dedicated to Ruqqus meta discussion. Content may involve technology and politics but must have ample context in Ruqqus.

📬 No spamming. Spamming comments or posts is not allowed.

😀 Be civil. Be nice. Harassment, trolling, and disruptive behavior is not allowed. Basically, don’t be a jerk.

📜 Follow Ruqqus ToS. This is a given.

For press releases, visit +RuqqusPress.

For updates and patch notes, visit +changelog.

For ideas and feedback, visit +BetaFeedback

For bug reports, visit +RuqqusBugs

📜 Follow Ruqqus ToS. This is a given.

For press releases, visit +RuqqusPress.

For updates and patch notes, visit +changelog.

For ideas and feedback, visit +BetaFeedback

For bug reports, visit +RuqqusBugs

post.title: Ruqqus is now quarantining guilds. Certain words in your post and you can’t reach /all.

body: Why do you feel the need to use the n-word to express yourself in dialogues about race? Is it not just as effective to get your point across by using "black person"? You reference +WhiteVictimsofBlackCrime. Why does it matter that the individual who committed the crime is black or white? If they committed a crime, then shouldn't the crime be the issue to highlight? You are doing nothing but contributing to the degradation of human relations in society today. If you want to see a better world, start criticizing the actions of individuals, not some arbitrary bullshit physical characteristic they had absolutely no control over.
body_html: Why do you feel the need to use the n-word to express yourself in dialogues about race? Is it not just as effective to get your point across by using "black person"? You reference +WhiteVictimsofBlackCrime. Why does it matter that the individual who committed the crime is black or white? If they committed a crime, then shouldn't the crime be the issue to highlight? You are doing nothing but contributing to the degradation of human relations in society today. If you want to see a better world, start criticizing the actions of individuals, not some arbitrary bullshit physical characteristic they had absolutely no control over.

body: I'm not agreeing with it being filtered or censored, simply highlighting the fact that it's not necessary to comment on the color of one's skin, especially when the "context" is that of someone committing a crime. I'm sure most would agree that all criminals do not deserve respect, regardless of race.
body_html: I'm not agreeing with it being filtered or censored, simply highlighting the fact that it's not necessary to comment on the color of one's skin, especially when the "context" is that of someone committing a crime. I'm sure most would agree that all criminals do not deserve respect, regardless of race.

body: Because every human being deserves to be evaluated by what they do with their time here, not by their physical characteristics. Without a doubt that person is a complete fucking scumbag, but not because he's black, because he robbed someone of their right to life.

body:
Yes that would be the offensive content filter, a user setting that filters ethnic slurs. 

All of your (worthless) posts will show up properly for anyone who has that setting turned off.
body_html:
Yes that would be the offensive content filter, a user setting that filters ethnic slurs.

All of your (worthless) posts will show up properly for anyone who has that setting turned off.

body: Here's the profile page with the option to use that file to do the filtering: https://github.com/ruqqus/ruqqus/blob/a157661532f3a662eb4b7b0107c2de8c4f68c01d/ruqqus/templates/settings_profile.html ``` Hide posts or collapse comments that include racial slurs. A full list of words can be found here ``` Interestingly I can't find the code that actually makes use of those words to do the filtering. Perhaps that part isn't commited yet.
body_html:
Here's the profile page with the option to use that file to do the filtering:

https://github.com/ruqqus/ruqqus/blob/a157661532f3a662eb4b7b0107c2de8c4f68c01d/ruqqus/templates/settings_profile.html

Hide posts or collapse comments that include racial slurs. A full list of words can be found <a href="/slurs.txt" target="_blank">here</a>

Interestingly I can't find the code that actually makes use of those words to do the filtering. Perhaps that part isn't commited yet.

post.title: Ruqqus is now quarantining guilds. Certain words in your post and you can’t reach /all.

body:
You made the claim that there was a quarantine.. 

However, just to prove there isnt:

https://github.com/ruqqus/ruqqus/blob/0696d5420fcd9c12fd91a3ea3d98cb0291942492/ruqqus/routes/front.py#L71 - Generating the query from user preferences, and failing back to hiding offensive content if there's no currently logged in user.

https://github.com/ruqqus/ruqqus/blob/0696d5420fcd9c12fd91a3ea3d98cb0291942492/ruqqus/routes/settings.py#L38 - Where that flag is persisted via the user settings

https://github.com/ruqqus/ruqqus/blob/0696d5420fcd9c12fd91a3ea3d98cb0291942492/ruqqus/routes/posts.py#L372 - Where new submissions get flagged as offensive, based upon a word list contained in the database.

https://github.com/ruqqus/ruqqus/blob/master/ruqqus/assets/slurs.txt <-- a surprisingly small file containing any words that are deemed offensive 

https://github.com/ruqqus/ruqqus/blob/42ceb7f320deec304816a5729bdeb4456fbeb006/ruqqus/templates/settings_profile.html <-- the user settings page which literally links to the slurs file above.

You can post as much shitty racism as you want, most of us don't want to see it. If you do, then just click the fucking button - it's not exactly hard is it?
body_html:
You made the claim that there was a quarantine..

However, just to prove there isnt:

https://github.com/ruqqus/ruqqus/blob/0696d5420fcd9c12fd91a3ea3d98cb0291942492/ruqqus/routes/front.py#L71 - Generating the query from user preferences, and failing back to hiding offensive content if there's no currently logged in user.

https://github.com/ruqqus/ruqqus/blob/0696d5420fcd9c12fd91a3ea3d98cb0291942492/ruqqus/routes/settings.py#L38 - Where that flag is persisted via the user settings

https://github.com/ruqqus/ruqqus/blob/0696d5420fcd9c12fd91a3ea3d98cb0291942492/ruqqus/routes/posts.py#L372 - Where new submissions get flagged as offensive, based upon a word list contained in the database.

https://github.com/ruqqus/ruqqus/blob/master/ruqqus/assets/slurs.txt <-- a surprisingly small file containing any words that are deemed offensive

https://github.com/ruqqus/ruqqus/blob/42ceb7f320deec304816a5729bdeb4456fbeb006/ruqqus/templates/settings_profile.html <-- the user settings page which literally links to the slurs file above.

You can post as much shitty racism as you want, most of us don't want to see it. If you do, then just click the fucking button - it's not exactly hard is it?

body:
I've given it a quick skim here - I can see where the query is built, but not any migrations etc which dump the list in the database. 

There's a few useful links here:

https://ruqqus.com/post/13az/ruqqus-is-now-quarantining-guilds-certain/3gpk

Mind you, I've only skimmed over the repository on my phone.

parent.body: Here's the profile page with the option to use that file to do the filtering: https://github.com/ruqqus/ruqqus/blob/a157661532f3a662eb4b7b0107c2de8c4f68c01d/ruqqus/templates/settings_profile.html ``` Hide posts or collapse comments that include racial slurs. A full list of words can be found here ``` Interestingly I can't find the code that actually makes use of those words to do the filtering. Perhaps that part isn't commited yet.
parent.body_html:
Here's the profile page with the option to use that file to do the filtering:

https://github.com/ruqqus/ruqqus/blob/a157661532f3a662eb4b7b0107c2de8c4f68c01d/ruqqus/templates/settings_profile.html

Hide posts or collapse comments that include racial slurs. A full list of words can be found <a href="/slurs.txt" target="_blank">here</a>

Interestingly I can't find the code that actually makes use of those words to do the filtering. Perhaps that part isn't commited yet.
